results.title: A Pride of islands
results.brief_description: Visiting the island of the Hebrides showing how they fish, farm and weave to make a living. The only airport in the world to the covered by water twice a day. The old battlements, castles and monuments 3000 years old. Safe haven from the sea for sailors of all nations.
results.description: Visiting the island of the Hebrides showing how they fish, farm and weave to make a living. The only airport in the world to the covered by water twice a day. The old battlements, castles and monuments 3000 years old. Safe haven from the sea for sailors of all nations.

results.title: A Practical guide to worm farming
results.brief_description: This video contains practical information on setting up a commercial worm farm, including: Pros and cons of different bed construction, worm biology/why worms, pests - including flatworms, common problems and how to overcome them, bedding, feeds, covers and harvesting.

results.title: A Positive approach to the psychiatric patient
results.brief_description: Shows the treatment in Veterans Administration hospital for psychiatric patients who have emerged from acute episodes of mental illness but who are not yet well enough to leave the hospital. Uses a hospital ward unit as the focal setting, and stresses the roles of the nurse aide and physician.

results.title: A Portrait of Katherine Mansfield
results.creator_credit: Julienne Stretton, Sue Kedgely and Marigold Productions
results.brief_description: This is the story of the short and extraordinary life of New Zealand writer Katherine Mansfield. Katherine Mansfield was one of the great short stories writers of the English language. Her work is still studied in over twenty languages.

results.title: A Pair of moccasins for Mary Thomas
results.creator_credit: Geoff Voyce, B T Filmsound and National Indian Arts and Crafts
results.brief_description: We follow Mary Thomas, a Sioux Interior Salish Indian, as she makes a pair of moccasins, the most common Indian footwear and a part of Indian cultural heritage. Starting from the treating of animal hide, Mary uses traditional methods, right through to the finished product.
results.title_for_label: A Pair of moccasins for Mary Thomas
results.creator_credit_for_label: Geoff Voyce, B T Filmsound and National Indian Arts and Crafts

results.title: The Bottom Rung
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Rich World Poor World”.
This program reports from Bangladesh, Tanzania and Brazil and highlights the extreme poverty there. It poses the question ‘Can the gap between rich world and poor world ever be closed?’

results.title: A New art in cooking
results.creator_credit: Jerry Warner and Lawry's Food Inc
results.brief_description: Every woman, no matter why her culinary talents, can produce unique and exciting cooking masterpieces in her own kitchen through the artistry of seasoning blends/ Employing works of master painters to introduce this concept, the film demonstrates the ease with which readily available seasoning ingredients can be used to add zest and variety to every meal. In addition, imaginative table settings provide new ideas.

results.title: A Natural question
results.creator_credit: Stan Gomm and Central Electricity Generating Board Film Unit
results.brief_description: Deals with the liaison between the sponsor and nature conservationists; showing some of the special nature trails they have set up for children in industrialised areas and describing other ways in which they are contributing towards nature conservancy. Presented by Phil Drabble with Art Direction by Richard Piper.
